lines.content: Neo Chatbot is a desktop app for **keeping track of tasks**, optimised for use via a **Command Line Interface (CLI)**.
1. Ensure you have Java `11` installed in your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for Neo Chatbot.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the `java -jar ip.jar` command to run the application.
5. Refer to the **Features** section below for details of each command.
- Words in `UPPER_CASE` are parameters to be supplied by the user.
e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo read book`.
- Items in square brackets are optional.
e.g. `/by DATE [TIME]` can be used as `/by 26/09/2001` or `/by 26/09/2001 2119`.
Adds a task to the list. Todo is a type of task that is not time-sensitive.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
- The number of tasks in the list shown above is just an example. Your actual output may differ depending on the number of tasks you have added.
Adds a task to the list. Deadline is a type of task that has a due date.
- The date follows DD/MM/YYYY format. e.g. 26/09/2023 represents 26 September 2023.
- The time follows HHMM in 24-Hour format. e.g. 1700 represents 5:00 PM.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
- The number of tasks in the list shown above is just an example. Your actual output may differ depending on the number of tasks you have added.
Adds a task to the list. Event is a type of task that has a start and end date.
- The date follows DD/MM/YYYY format. e.g. 26/09/2023 represents 26 September 2023.
- The time follows HHMM in 24-Hour format. e.g. 1700 represents 5:00 PM.
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] read book (from: Tuesday, 26 September 2023 to: Thursday, 28 September 2023)
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] read book (from: Tuesday, 26 September 2023, 5:00 PM to: Thursday, 28 September 2023, 7:00 PM)
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
- The number of tasks in the list shown above is just an example. Your actual output may differ depending on the number of tasks you have added.
Shows a list of all tasks.
Marks the task at the specified index in the list as done.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
- The task shown above is just an example. Your actual output may differ depending on the task you have added.
Marks the task at the specified index in the list as undone.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
- The task shown above is just an example. Your actual output may defer depending on the task you have added.
Deletes the task at the specified index in the list.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
- The task shown above is just an example. Your actual output may defer depending on the task you have added.
- The number of tasks in the list shown above is just an example. Your actual output may defer depending on the number of tasks you have added.
Finds all tasks with descriptions that match the keyword.
- The search is case-insensitive. e.g `read book` will match `Read Book`.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
- The task shown above is just an example. Your actual output may defer depending on the task you have added.
* This is the main class of Neo chatbot.
* Main method where data.txt file is loaded or generated, along with creating
* the list for storing the tasks.
* If data.txt file remains unreadable, program will exit.
* A form of throwable that indicates conditions specific to Neo chatbot that can be caught.
* Constructs exception with parameters to indicate the type of exception.
* @param description Describes which part of task caused the error
* @param type The type of error that was caused
* Prints the exception and recommended actions to the user.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description cannot be left empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of " + description + " cannot be left empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please check that " + description + " is included in the command.");

* @param timeValueType It specifies which component of date or time has an impossible value.
* @param timeErrorType It specifies which type of error occurred.
public NeoTimeException(TimeType timeType, TimeValueType timeValueType, TimeErrorType timeErrorType) {
* Prints the exception and recommended actions to the user.
System.out.println("Please make sure the day is from 0-31.");
System.out.println("Please make sure the month is from 0-12.");
System.out.println("Please make sure the hours is from 0-23.");
System.out.println("Please make sure the minutes is from 0-59.");
System.out.println("Please make sure you have the correct format for date. (DD/MM/YYYY)");
System.out.println("Please make sure you have the correct format for date and time. (DD/MM/YYYY HHmm)");
* Represents a form of task that has a due date.

* @param by This is the description of the due date.

* Returns the deadline in an easy-to-read format to the user.

* Constructs a task with a string to indicate the starting date and due date.
* @param description This is the description of the task.
* @param from This is the description of the starting date.
* @param to This is the description of the due date.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* (Day of Week), (Day) (Full name of Month) (Year) HH:mm AM/PM. If there is no time,

* Marks the given task specified in the input string from the user. Prints exceptions
* where task index given is not specified or out of bounds of the task list.

System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please give the index of which task to mark.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please make sure the index given is within the current list.");
* Unmarks the given task specified in the input string from the user. Prints exceptions
* where task index given is not specified or out of bounds of the task list.

System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: ");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please give the index of which task to unmark.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please make sure the index given is within the current list.");

System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please give the index of which task to delete.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! Please make sure the index given is within the current list.");

* Represents the methods related to catching input errors. This class is abstract as its
* main purpose is to provide methods to catch errors.
* Catches errors when user inputs the wrong format while trying to add tasks to the list.
* @param type This is the type of task that the user intends to add.
* @param line This is the user input line.
* @throws NeoTaskException If wrong format is detected.
public static void catchFormatError(CommandType type, String line) throws NeoTaskException {
* Catches errors when a line in data.txt file does not match the required parameters
* for the task it is representing.
* @param type This is the type of task that the user intends to add.
* @param arraySize This is the number of parameters in the line from data.txt.
* @throws NeoTaskException if the number of parameters from the line in data.txt and the required
*                          parameters for its task type do not match.
public static void catchReadFormatError(CommandType type, int arraySize) throws NeoTaskException {

* Represents the methods relating to writing and reading from data.txt file.
* Finds and read data.txt file in data/data.txt path relative to working directory.
* If data.txt and its parent folder does not exist, it will create those files.
* If data.txt file is unreadable, it will delete and create a new data.txt file
* If the user does not want to delete existing data.txt file, it will throw exception.
* Content of data.txt are used to fill up the task list.
* @param list This is the list of tasks to be filled up according to the content
* @throws Exception if data.txt file remains unreadable.

* main purpose is to provide methods relating to interaction with the user.
